channel.title: Replacing screen on acer5742z 15.6"
channel.description:
basically the screen on my housemates laptop has broken, dropped it when drunk afaik and he needs the screen replacing. do you think it is something I would be able to do reletively easy or would it be better to send it off to have it repaired.
http://www.laptopscreenonline.com/acer-aspire-5742-156-hd-led-lcd-laptop-screen-15185-p.asp

item.title: Replacing screen on acer5742z 15.6"
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

It was pretty easy to replace, took about 30 mins, I had to go buy a smaller screwdriver as my standard phillips was too big (probably worn away due to overuse) but they sold a smaller one at the DIY store for £2.99, overall it cost me £55 ish, i was quoted £150 with a £50 pickup fee, saved over £150.

would recommend this option to anyone who has some level of confidence with computers.

Read full topic

item.title: Replacing screen on acer5742z 15.6"
item.dc:creator: @Cbot Cbot
item.description:
@Cbot wrote:

You probably just saved yourself $300-$500. I remember when I cracked my laptop screen. Staples tried to make me pay $500 to replace and install it. It took me 10 minutes to unscrew, unplug the broken laptop screen, plug the new one and screw. It should all go well as long as nothing breaks again

Read full topic

item.title: Replacing screen on acer5742z 15.6"
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Ordered a screen will let you know how it goes

Read full topic

item.title: Replacing screen on acer5742z 15.6"
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It’s very easy to replace, you’ll need a screwdriver or two, but that’s it, it just unscrews and unplugs. My brother makes some pretty good money at college replacing screens on rich student’s laptops.

Read full topic

item.title: Replacing screen on acer5742z 15.6"
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

If I were you, I’d do it myself. You’ll probably have to pay quite a lot for the replacing.

Read full topic
